answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Eric – below are some links to various countywide eco dev plans.  Hope they are helpful:
San Luis Obispo – County Eco Strategy
http://www.sloevc.org/slo-county-business/slo-county-economic-strategy.php
Genesee County – Metro Compressive Eco Dev Strategy
http://www.metro-community.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=276:genesee-county-comprehensive-economic-development-strategy-ceds&catid=70:features&Itemid=226
Sonoma County, CA - Economic Development Strategy and Jobs Plan
http://edb.sonoma-county.org/documents/2012/EconomicDevelopmentStrategyJobsPlan.pdf
Municipal Research Services Center, WA – Planning & Economic development Plans
http://www.mrsc.org/subjects/econ/ed-plans.aspx
Good luck,
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org

answers.author: Tad McGalliard
answers.text:
Hi Eric,  One resource you might consult is ICMA's Putting Smart Growth to Work in Rural Communities.  You can find it at 
icma.org/ruralsmartgrowth

answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
I am a little late to this discussion but for what it is worth, there is a document known by the acronym CEDS which is the Comprehensive Economic Development Strategy for a county or region required by the US Department of Commerce Economic Development Administration... These CEDS are prepared and regularly updated by the Regional Planning Commissions or Districts and are usually available online in theier websites.  CEDS are a really good source and are likely available in your state.

author: Eric Cline
text: I am looking for some examples of a countywide economic development plan. The County requesting this information is a small rural county (pop: <15,000) with only three small urban centers and limited infrastructure. Any examples of plans that could be applicable to such a community is most appreciated.
title: County Economic Development Plan
